All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
GameListener
The GameListener class implements the interface KeyListener, and is responsible for hearing the user's game inputs for the striker in our Mini-Soccer Game.
GameMenuBar
The GameMenuBar class is a child of JMenuBar, and contains all of the elements and controls in the menu bar which help our Mini-Soccer Game function correctly.
GamePanel
The GamePanel class extends JPanel, and contains all the elements of our Mini-Soccer Game contained within a window.
GamePlayer
GamePlayer is the abstract base class for all players involved in the Mini-Soccer Game.
Goalkeeper
Goalkeeper is a child class of GamePlayer, and is a player.
GoalkeeperTest
 
MenubarListener
The MenubarListener class implements the ActionListener interface, and is responsible for hearing the user's menu bar inputs such as pause, resume, quit and restart during our Mini-Soccer Game.
MiniSoccerApp
The MiniSoccerApp class represents the entirety of the elements which make up the Mini-Soccer Game in one runnable application.
PlayerCollection
PlayerCollection implements the interface Iterable.
PlayerCollectionTest
 
PlayerFactory
Player factory which creates different kinds of players.
PlayerStatistics
PlayerStatistics is the object which stores the important statistic of a player in our Mini-Soccer Game.
SoccerBall
SoccerBall is the class which represents the soccer ball in our Mini-Soccer Game.
SoccerBallTest
 
SoccerGame
The SoccerGame class represents the key functionality of our Mini-Soccer Game and the implementation of this class is what allows for the game as well as the roles of the players to function as intended.
SoccerGameTest
 
Striker
Striker is a child class of GamePlayer, and is a player.
StrikerTest
